header.title: DIABO MAIORAL DA QUIMBANDA (Sua Majestade EXU REI)

central_thesis: The text systematically details the hierarchical structure and dominion of the supreme entity in Quimbanda, 'Exu Rei' (the Maioral), delineating his primary manifestations, the subordinate spirits under his various aspects, and the organization of the 'Sete Reinos' (Seven Realms) within the Quimbanda pantheon, thus outlining a comprehensive operative framework for practitioners.

structure_content.chapter_title: The Three Personalities of the Maioral da Quimbanda
structure_content.summary: This section introduces the three principal manifestations of Exu Rei: LÚCIFER (Exu Rei das 7 Liras), BELZEBU (Exu Mor / Exu das 9 Luzes), and ASTAROTH (Exu Rei das 7 Encruzilhadas). It then lists the immediate sub-entities governed by Lúcifer (SATANACKIA and AGALIERAP), Beelzebuth (TARCHIMACHE and FLERUTY), and Astaroth (SAGATANA and NESBIROS), establishing the initial layers of the hierarchy.

structure_content.chapter_title: LUCIFUGE ROFOCALE: The Infernal Prime Minister
structure_content.summary: Identifies LUCIFUGE ROFOCALE as Exu Rei dos 7 Cruzeiros and explicitly designates him as the 'Primeiro-Ministro infernal,' citing the Grand Grimoire as a source, thereby linking this Quimbanda lineage to established Western grimoire traditions.

structure_content.chapter_title: Duque SYRACH and His 18 Inferior Spirits
structure_content.summary: Outlines the dominion of Duque SYRACH (Exu Calunga), who commands 18 specific inferior spirits. Each spirit is named and associated with a particular Exu manifestation (e.g., CLAUNECK - Exu Pedra Preta, KLEPOTH - Pombagira Rainha da Praia), detailing specific functions and elemental/thematic associations.

structure_content.chapter_title: SATANACHIA, SATANICIAE, and Their Demonic Chiefs
structure_content.summary: Describes SATANACHIA (Exu Marabô) and SATANICIAE as governing 45 (or 54) demons. It lists four key 'Chefes' (Chiefs) under their command: SERGUTTHY (Exu Mirim), HERAMAEL (Exu Curador), TRIMASAEL (Exu Pimenta), and SUSTUGRIEL (Exu Malê), providing insight into the command structure and specialized roles.
Details AGALIAREPT (Exu Mangueira) and TARIHIMAL (Exu Kaminaloá) as co-governors of ELELOGAP (Exu 7 Montanhas), highlighting another specific chain of command within the Quimbanda hierarchy.

Presents NEBIROTS, identified with Omulú, as a significant entity who commands HAEL (Exu Meia-Noite) and SERGULATH (Exu Caveira). It further enumerates a comprehensive list of nine Exus governed by HAEL and SERGULATH, each with distinct attributes (e.g., PROCLO - Exu Tatá Caveira, HARISTUM - Exu Brasa), solidifying the intricate sub-hierarchies.

structure_content.chapter_title: SETE (7) REINOS: The Seven Realms of Quimbanda
structure_content.summary: This crucial section defines the seven distinct 'Reinos' or operational realms within Quimbanda: Encruzilhadas, Cruzeiros, Matas, Kalunga Pequena, Almas, Lira, and Praia. For each Reino, it identifies the primary governing Exu Rei and his corresponding Pombagira Rainha (e.g., Reino das Encruzilhadas: ASTAROTH - Exu Rei das 7 Encruzilhadas and ASTARTÉ - Pombagira Rainha das 7 Encruzilhadas), providing a clear map of spiritual territories and their rulers.

key_concepts.definition: The supreme governing entity within this Quimbanda system, identified as 'Exu Rei,' who manifests through three primary personalities: Lucifer, Beelzebuth, and Astaroth, each with distinct dominions and subordinate spirits.

Spirits or deities in Afro-Brazilian religions, particularly Quimbanda. In this context, they are powerful, often hierarchical entities associated with specific domains, powers, and points of action (e.g., crossroads, cemeteries, forests). The text details numerous Exus with specific titles (e.g., Exu Pedra Preta, Exu 7 Liras).

Female spiritual entities in Afro-Brazilian religions, serving as counterparts to Exus. The text specifically mentions 'Pombagira Rainha' in the context of governing the 'Reinos,' indicating their royal status within certain domains (e.g., Pombagira Rainha da Praia, Pombagira Rainha das Almas).

A lineage of magical texts originating in Western Esotericism, detailing the invocation and control of spirits. The text explicitly references the 'Grand Grimoire' in relation to Lucifuge Rofocale and incorporates names like Lucifer, Astaroth, Satanachia, and Syrach, indicating a syncretic blend of Afro-Brazilian and European occult influences.

Seven distinct spiritual domains or territories within the Quimbanda cosmology, each governed by a specific Exu Rei and Pombagira Rainha. These realms (Encruzilhadas, Cruzeiros, Matas, Kalunga Pequena, Almas, Lira, Praia) define spheres of influence and specific areas of magical operation.

The meticulously structured chain of command among the spirits, from the Maioral down through his primary aspects, dukes, chiefs, and individual Exus. This hierarchy is fundamental to understanding the flow of power and the proper protocol for interaction within the Quimbanda system.

practical_system.description: The document describes a highly structured spiritual system based on a supreme 'Maioral' (Exu Rei) who operates through three primary aspects (Lucifer, Beelzebuth, Astaroth) and numerous subordinate entities. This hierarchy extends through figures like Lucifuge Rofocale (Prime Minister), Duque Syrach (commander of 18 spirits), Satanachia and Sataniciae (governors of numerous demons), Agaliarept and Tarihimal, and Nebirots/Omulú (commanding figures like Hael and Sergulath). Each spirit is typically associated with a specific 'Exu' title and a domain (e.g., Exu Pedra Preta, Exu dos Ventos, Exu 7 Liras, Exu dos Cemitérios), indicating their specific powers and areas of influence. The system culminates in the 'Sete Reinos' (Seven Realms), which categorize the operational spheres of Quimbanda, each ruled by an Exu Rei and a Pombagira Rainha. This entire framework serves as a detailed map for identifying, invoking, and directing specific spiritual forces for magical or religious purposes based on their assigned rank and domain.
tools: Though not explicitly mentioned in the provided text, the naming conventions suggest the use of specific offerings, 'pontos riscados' (sacred symbols drawn on the ground), candles, colors, and possibly specific altars or 'assentamentos' dedicated to these entities, as is customary in Quimbanda practice. The names themselves are potent tools for evocation and invocation.
rituals: While explicit rituals are not detailed, the text provides the essential nomenclature for invocation and petition within the Quimbanda tradition. Practitioners would utilize the names of the Maiorais, their aspects, dukes, and subordinate Exus/Pombagiras to address specific entities for magical work. The specific titles (e.g., 'Exu dos Ventos,' 'Exu dos Cemitérios') guide the practitioner in choosing the appropriate spirit for a desired outcome (e.g., calling Exu dos Ventos for matters related to communication or swift change, Exu dos Cemitérios for ancestral work or matters of transition). The hierarchical structure implies a protocol for addressing higher-ranking entities for broader influences, or specific subordinates for niche tasks.

The 'Reinos' define the energetic and physical locations for specific types of work (e.g., rituals for protection or opening paths might involve the Reino das Encruzilhadas, while those related to healing or justice might involve the Reino das Almas).

critical_analysis.relevance: This document is highly relevant for understanding the syncretic nature of Quimbanda, which distinctively blends traditional African spiritual concepts of Exu with prominent figures and hierarchical structures from Western grimoire traditions (e.g., Lucifer, Beelzebuth, Astaroth, Lucifuge Rofocale, Syrach, Satanachia). It provides a foundational, highly structured overview of a specific Quimbanda lineage's pantheon and its intricate chain of command, crucial for both scholarly analysis of Afro-Brazilian religions and for practitioners seeking to navigate the spiritual landscape of this system. The detailed enumeration of spirits and their specific domains offers a practical framework for identifying and interacting with entities for targeted magical operations, differentiating this text from more generalized descriptions of Quimbanda.
critical_analysis.target_audience: The target audience includes practitioners of Quimbanda, particularly those seeking to understand the specific hierarchy and associated entities within a grimoire-influenced lineage. It is also valuable for scholars of Afro-Brazilian religions, Western Esotericism, comparative religion, and occultists interested in the practical application and syncretic evolution of magical systems.
